title: Brexit.The.Battle.For.Britain.EN.SUB.MPEG4.x264.WEBRIP.[MPup]
description:
BBC.Documentaries.2016.08.08.Brexit.The.Battle.For.Britain.EN.SUB.MPEG4.x264.WEBRIP.[MPup]

Format: MPEG-4

Size: 1280x720
DisplayAspectRatio: 16:9
FrameRate: 25.000 fps
AudioCodec: AAC
Channels: 2 channels
SamplingRate: 48.0 KHz


On 23 June, Britain was hit by a political earthquake. Within hours of the EU referendum result, the Prime Minister had resigned, the pound fell and Westminster was reeling. So how and why did this political revolution happen - and how does it stand to reshape Britain's politics?

In this film, the BBC's Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg tells the inside story of how David Cameronâ€™s huge political gamble went wrong. Talking to the politicians and the people who ran the campaigns, she'll find out how a perfect storm brewed, which would end Cameronâ€™s premiership and throw the Labour Party into chaos, as well as reshaping Britain's place in the world for a generation.

In Sunderland - an area where the result sent Britain's political classes into shock - voters, politicians and activists will describe how the groundswell of protest grew. And Laura will explore how a gulf opened up between Westminster and large parts of modern Britain.

Just weeks on from the referendum, British politics is already transformed: we have a new Prime Minister, Nigel Farage has bowed out, and Jeremy Corbyn's opponents within Labour have moved against him. But that is just the beginning: the effects of this result will be felt for decades.

This film tells the inside story of how it happened
